You may also be looking for Third Age 1919.

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1919.

content.title: Early
content.content: ? - J.R.R. Tolkien begins his two years of work on the Oxford English Dictionary.

content.title: January
content.content: 1 - J.R.R. Tolkien starts a new diary, mainly written in the Alphabet of RÃºmil.

content.title: February
content.content: 17 - Hilary Tolkien returns home after the War.

content.title: June
content.content: 14 - Dutch translator Willy Wielek-Berg is born.

content.title: July
content.content: 15 - Tolkien is officially released from service, well a year after the war's end.

content.title: September
content.content: ? - J.R.R. Tolkien acquires a copy of the Early English Text Society edition of Morte Arthure.

content.title: November
content.content: 11 - The Ministry of Pensions sends a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien, on which he wrote a draft of The Ruined Enchanter: A Fairy Ballad.

? - Tolkien receives his M.A. from Exeter College.
Years
1916 1917 1918 1919 1920 1921 1922
